title: cumber
body:
Alternatively referred to as the "Evil Saiyan", Cumber is a [[Saiyan]] from an ancient era that was brought to the present by [[fu_(dragon_ball)|Fu]] alongside several others for his experiments in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]].

[Spoilers]Cumber's title as an "Evil Saiyan" is derived from the fact that his ki can make other Saiyans go berserk if they touch it. This seems to only work on fullblooded Saiyans, as it was ineffective on [[Trunks_(Future)_(Dragon_ball)|Trunks]]. Additionally, he later allies with [[Son Goku]] and his friends alongside [[Hearts (Dragon Ball)|Hearts]]. The manga for Dragon Ball Heroes implies that he may have killed a god, but this has yet to be elaborated on. [/spoilers]
other_names: カンバー(ドラゴンボール)

title: aeos_(dragon_ball)
body:
Aeos is a [[kaioushin]] woman that appears in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]]. She was the former Supreme Kai of Time, with [[Chronoa]] succeeding her. Alongside Chronoa, she also mentored [[Demigra]] and [[Mechikabura]] before they were banished. In the present, she returns with 4 chosen warriors to make a tournament to decide which timeline to keep, after becoming dissatisfied with Chronoa's performance as a Supreme Kai of Time.

[Spoiler] After the tournament and an attack by Demigra, Aeos reconciles with Chronoa and decides to not erase any timelines. [/spoiler]
other_names: アイオス(ドラゴンボール)

title: lagss
body:
Lagss is a character in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] that is a member of the Core Area Warriors during the Prison Planet arc. She is from a long extinct race known as the Glass Tribe. 

[Spoiler] The Glass Tribe is later revealed by [[vidro_(dragon_ball)|Vidro]] to have been wiped out by [[Chilled]]. However, it has been stated by writers that Lagss and Vidro are not from the same timeline. Additionally, at the end of Universe Mission, Lagsss is absorbed by Majin Ozotto. She is not freed until Meteor Mission alongside her former ally, [[hearts_(dragon_ball)|Hearts]] [/spoiler]
other_names: ラグス(ドラゴンボール)

title: robelu
body: Robelu is a character from [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] that serves as a secretary to [[Demigra]]. In the manga, she is shown to often subtly poke fun at her ally, Chamel, and is quite flattered when [[pan_(xeno)_(dragon_ball)|Pan]] calls her pretty, remarking how she suddenly likes Pan more afterward. She appears to have an animosity towards characters that betrayed Demigra in the past, such as [[putine_(dragon_ball)|Putine]] and [[gravy_(dragon_ball)|Gravy]].
other_names: ロベル(ドラゴンボール)

title: dobermann_(arknights)
body:
[i]Dobermann, Starter instructor of Rhodes Island, is always ready to offer advice on the battlefield.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Bolívar[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]May 27[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Perro[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]163 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]6 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Rhodes Island's drill instructor for new recruits. Her training is hellish, but she has a heart of gold.

Former colonel of the Bolívarian Coalition Government, later defected to the Resistance, but then realized that none of the three sides of the civil war were seeking a better future for the country. She joined the neutral Rhodes Island after contracting Oripathy.

Her motif is based on the dobermann dog.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] (Japanese), Gui Niang (Chinese), Lucy Montgomery (English), and Kim Hyun-ji (Korean). Her art designer is [[LLC]].

h4. Skins
* !post #5959877: Default
* !post #4179723: [[Dobermann (lieutenant) (arknights)|Lieutenant]]
other_names: ドーベルマン(アークナイツ)

title: nugimashou_ka?
body:
A phrase that the [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] [[sengo muramasa (touken ranbu)| Sengo Muramasa]] says in the Citadel (どうかしましたか? 脱ぎまショウか?/[i]Dokashimashita ka? Nugimashou ka?[/i]), roughly translating to "What's the matter? Shall I undress?"

Muramasa makes several references to stripping down in his quotes, with little rhyme or reason to do so. Many jokes are had with this quirk, having Muramasa strip for the flimsiest of reasons much to the ire of [[tonbokiri (touken ranbu)|Tonbokiri]].

title: pregnancy_mark
body:
A [[tattoo]] of sorts on the stomach used to count how many times a character got [[pregnant]]/how many children that character had.

Usually more tattoos are added the more children one has, similar to a [[tally]].

The symbol is often a heart or child icon, but sometimes the number of persons or details are written directly in text.

When a child has died due to miscarriage, abortion, etc., a heart break symbol or a child icon with a diagonal line is often used.

When the purpose is to abort a child from the beginning, it is called an “abortion mark” and is distinguished from a “pregnancy mark”.


h4. See Also
* [[pubic tattoo]]
* [[maternity mark]]
* [[abortion mark]]

title: meowy_(chainsaw_man)
body:
Character from [[Chainsaw Man]]. She is [[Power (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s beloved [[white cat]].

Meowy was brought under the care of [[Power (Chainsaw Man)|]], who originally intended to fatten up Meowy before eating. [[Power (Chainsaw Man)|]] eventually become attached to Meowy and they were together for a long time until Meowy was captured by the [[Bat Devil (Chainsaw Man)|]], who promised that if a human were brought to him, he would return the cat to her. However, the Bat Devil would go back on his word and proceeds to eat Meowy and then Power later on. [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] would then kill the Bat Devil and rescue both of them.

title: chainsaw_devil
body:
The true form of the Chainsaw Devil from [[Chainsaw Man]], also known as "The Hero of Hell" or "Chainsaw Man". For the same character's dog-like form, see [[Pochita_(chainsaw_man)|]]. For the other character referred to as "Chainsaw Man", see [[Denji_(chainsaw_man)|]].

Do not use this tag for [[Denji_(chainsaw_man)|]] in his Devil form. [[Denji_(chainsaw_man)|]]'s devil form has an orange cover for his [[Chainsaw]] head and two organic arm, while the Chainsaw Devil has a dark grey/black [[Chainsaw]] head and two or four mechanical arms.

title: pochita_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A character in [[Chainsaw Man]]. Pochita is the [[Chainsaw Devil]] who embodies the fear of [[chainsaw]]s. He was the original Chainsaw Man (チェンソーマン, Chensō Man) prior to becoming [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]]'s heart and the source of his transformation power.

He is a small, orange dog-like creature depicted in a cartoonish appearance. His distinctive appearance consist of a [[chainsaw]] blade sticking out of his head and a rip cord for a tail.

Her abilities include [[hemokinesis|manipulating blood]], which she often uses to form weapons in battle.

She also [[breast padding|pads her chest]], so the chest size she is usually depicted with is a result of padding. This revelation caused [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]] to have an existential crisis.

title: all_might
body:
Character from [i][[Boku no Hero Academia]][/i]. The #1 superhero and a symbol of strength and the eighth hero of the "One For All" linage. He was mentored by [[Shimura Nana]] and in turn mentors [[Midoriya Izuku]].

His Quirk is "One for All", which allowed him to obtain any Quirks from those who were willing to give it for him, as well as capable of transferring it to the others.

All Might is known to have two forms;
* In his true form, he's [[emaciated|scrawny]] and almost skeletal, constantly [[coughing blood|coughing up blood]] and his hair is [[messy hair|messy]] with [[bangs]] hanging in front of his face, eyes visible.
* In his hero form, he's [[muscular male|muscular]], with the hair becoming [[hair slicked back|slicked-back]] and the two bangs turning into [[antenna hair]] pointing outwards of his head. At that time his eyes become [[covered eyes|covered]] [[shaded face|by the shade]] presumably cast by his eyebrows.

His true name is [[Yagi Toshinori]].

title: velvet_crowe
body:
Main heroine of [[Tales of Berseria]]. A young woman who endured a traumatic event three years prior to the main game and is seeking revenge for what happened. Her left arm had turned into a monstrous black and red claw that can devour other beings. Velvet used to be a kind and caring girl, but is now a cold-hearted loner who will do whatever it takes to achieve her revenge. Her seiyuu is [[Satou Rina]]; she is voiced in English by [[Cristina Valenzuela]].

Designed by the late [[Inomata Mutsumi]].

title: kurt_knispel
body:
[b]Kurt Knispel[/b] (20 September 1921 – 28 April 1945) was a [[germany|German]] [[tank]] commander during [[World War II]]. Knispel was a Sudeten German born in [[Czechoslovakia]] who started his career as a [[Panzer IV]] and [[Tiger I]] gunner (in [[Tiger 101]]). 

He is considered the [b]greatest tank ace ever[/b] with [b]168 confirmed kills[/b] during the war. Heavily disliked by the most fanatical Nazi officials, he never rose through the ranks more than commander because of an incident where Knispel defended a [[Soviet Army]] P.O.W. after seeing him being beaten by a [[Waffen-SS]] [[soldier]]. Kurt pointed his sidearm at the SS guard and forced him to stop. Knispel was also usually seen [[beard]]ed, hairy and umkept, what went against regulations. The look of the character [[Sergeant Oddball]] from [[Kelly's Heroes]] was actually based on Knispel.

Knispel was severely wounded on 28 April 1945 by shrapnel to his head when his [[Tiger II]] was hit during battle with [[Soviet]] tanks in the Eastern Front. He died two hours later in a German field hospital nearby just a few days before the end of the war.

h4. See also
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kurt_Knispel

* [[Michael Wittmann]]

title: high_score_girl
body:
[b]High Score Girl[/b] is a 2010 comedy manga series by [[Oshikiri Rensuke]].

Known as a "1990s [[arcade]] romantic comedy", the series revolves around the life of gamer [[Yaguchi Haruo]], the coin-op gaming scene, and the changes that develop within both over time. The series is notable for it's unique [[retro artstyle]] and thoroughly accurate depictions of the multitude of [[video game]] software, hardware, and even culture from that era. The title of the manga is a pun on the term "High School Girl".

On August 5, 2014, Osaka District Police searched the offices of [[Square Enix]], the publishers of the manga, acting on an IP violation claim by [[SNK]] Playmore stating that the comic allegedly features over 100 instances of characters from [[The King of Fighters]], [[Samurai Spirits]], and other fighting games. In response, Square Enix voluntarily recalled all printed volumes and temporarily suspended publication of future volumes and digital sales (and put the anime on hold). However, the manga continued its run in [i]Monthly Big Gangan[/i] only.

In August 2015 it was reported that Square Enix and SNK Playmore had finally reached a settlement, cancelling the lawsuit and enabling the manga to be sold everywhere (and the anime produced) once again. 

The weekly official anime adaptation was finally released in 2018 with twelve 24 min. episodes. In 2019, Extra Stage OVA and season 2 were released. All 24 episodes were made by Studio J.C.Staff and available on Netflix.

The original manga series ended in 2018. In 2019 it was followed by [i]High Score Girl Dash[/i], a spinoff sequel that focuses on [[Hidaka Koharu]], now a middle school teacher.

A set of two 2D arcade games developed and published by [[Capcom]] in the 1990s, based on the [[Dungeons & Dragons]] tabletop role-playing game. The first game was [i]Dungeons & Dragons: Tower of Doom[/i] released in 1994, followed by [i]Dungeons & Dragons: Shadow over Mystara[/i] in 1996. title: qing_dynasty
body:
The [b]Qing dynasty[/b], officially the Great Qing, was a Manchu-led imperial dynasty of China and the last [[Chinese Empire|imperial dynasty in Chinese history]] (not counting the puppet state of [[Manchukuo]] or [[Yuan Shikai]]'s short-lived Empire of China in 1917).

It emerged from the Later Jin dynasty founded by a Tungusic-speaking ethnic group who became known as the [[Manchu]]s. The dynasty was officially proclaimed in 1636 in Mukden (modern-day Shenyang), and following the Battle of Shanhai Pass it seized control of [[Beijing]] in 1644, which is often considered the start of the dynasty's rule in China. Within decades the Qing had consolidated its control over the whole of China proper and [[Taiwan]], and by the mid-18th century it had expanded its rule into Inner Asia. 

During the 19th century to the early 20th century, the Qing suffered from numerous defeat and setback as a result of intervention from various European colonial powers (primarily the [[United Kingdom]] and the [[Russian Empire]]) and later with the recently modernized [[Japan|Empire of Japan]], which resulted into a power struggle between the reformist and reactionary. This, combined with surge in anti-Manchu dissent among the Han Chinese, resulted into the downfall of the dynasty when it was overthrown in the Xinhai Revolution in 1912.

In Chinese historiography, the Qing dynasty was preceded by the [[Ming dynasty]] and succeeded by the [[Kuomintang|Republic of China]]. The multiethnic Qing dynasty assembled the territorial base for [[China|modern China]]. During its peak, it was the largest imperial dynasty in the history of China and in 1790 the fourth-largest empire in world history in terms of territorial size. With 419,264,000 citizens in 1907, it was the most populous country in the world at the time.

h4. See also:
* [[China]]
* [[Chinese Empire]]
* [[Fu Manchu (mustache) ]]
* [[Manchu clothes]]
* [[Qingdai Guanmao]]

h1. External links:
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qing_dynasty

title: uchi_no_hime-sama_ga_ichiban_kawaii
body:
Uchi no Hime-sama ga Ichiban Kawaii (My Princess Is The Cutest) is a Japanese Card-based RPG for iOS.

In Uchihime, the princesses of the land had been imprisoned into crystals by the Demon King. The player takes the role of a prince who was cursed into an [[kaeru_ouji|anthropomorphic frog]]. However, despite being cursed with a seemingly permanent and debilitating transmogrification, the prince can still battle the army of the Demon King. Together with the help of [[anna_(uchi_no_hime-sama_ga_ichiban_kawaii) |Anna]], a fairy who acts as a magical slingshot and a guide, the prince sets course to rescue the captured princesses and defeat the Demon King.

The main storyline revolves around four princesses: [[lina_princella|Princess Lina]], [[akane_garnet|Princess Akane]], [[marina_sophia|Princess Sophia]], and [[clarice_lapis|Princess Lapis]].

title: phoenix
body:
A mythical sacred fire[[bird]] originated from the [[Greek mythology]]; a fire spirit with a colorful plumage and a tail of gold and scarlet. According to legend the creature always rises from the ashes of its own previously deceased form. It symbolizes immortality and the eternal cycle of death and rebirth. 

h4. See also

* [[bird]]
* [[fenghuang]]
* [[Fujiwara no Mokou]], a character often associated with phoenixes
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]
* [[Hi no Tori]], a franchise created by [[Tezuka Osamu]] based on the mythical creature.
* [[Suzaku]], vermilion bird of the south, one of the "Four Symbols":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four_Symbols_%28China%29 of the Chinese constellations.

title: fenghuang
body:
[b]Fenghuang[/b], known in Japanese as [b]Houou[/b], are mythological birds found in East Asian mythology that reign over all other birds. Originally [i]feng[/i] referred to the males and [i]huang[/i] to the females, but such a distinction of gender is often no longer made.

The fenghuang is also called the "August Rooster" since it sometimes takes the place of the Rooster in the [[Chinese zodiac]]. In the Western world it is often called the "Chinese [[phoenix]]", or simply "phoenix", however the two have dissimilar traits and are of mostly independent origin.

h4. Further information
* "Wikipedia: Fenghuang":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fenghuang

title: skadi_(arknights)
body:
[i]Skadi, bounty hunter, has come with the tide to drown your enemies.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ægir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]March 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Unknown[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]166 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]13 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A famous bounty hunter from the Abyssal Hunters. She is very experienced in combat, but her history prior to becoming a bounty hunter is a mystery. In the minds of her fellow bounty hunters and operators, she is a literal walking Catastrophe. She is now an Operator for a Rhodes Island assault team, and also executes solo missions. Her choice of weapon is a huge sword, which she swings like a golf club to attack.

Together with [[Grani_(Arknights)|]], she is the secondary protagonist in the side story [i]Grani and the Knights' Treasure[/i].

Her motif is based on an [[orca]]. Her callsign is derived from the Norse goddess of hunting and winter.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Satou Rina]] (Japanese), Zhang Qi (Chinese), Cristina Vee (English), and Kim Na-yul (Korean). Her art designer is [[alchemaniac]].

title: telnyashka
body:
The Russian telnyashka is a [[white_shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] that is horizontally [[striped_shirt|striped]] in various colors and which may be [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] or not. It was originally adopted by the Imperial Russian Navy in the 19th century and spread to other Soviet units during and after the Second World War. This iconic uniform garment continues to be worn today, particularly by the Navy, the  Airborne Troops ([[VDV]]) and the  Naval Infantry. 

The color of the horizontal stripes traditionally signify different troops:
* Dark blue - Navy
* Black - Naval Infantry
* Light blue - VDV paratroopers
* Light green - Border Troops

title: obrez
body:
An [i]obrez[/i] is a rifle that has been hastily converted into a makeshift handgun by shortening the barrel and sawing off the shoulder stock. The canonical [i]obrez[/i] is based on the [[bolt action]] [[Mosin-Nagant]]. The term is a [[Russian text|Russian]] word that means "sawn-off" or "cut-off".

It supposedly originated during the Russian Revolution of 1917, when revolutionaries are said to have captured/stolen military rifles and cut them down for concealability purposes.  In practice, a full-power military [[rifle]] circa the turn of the 20th century makes for a ludicrously unwieldy [[handgun]], and although contemporary examples do exist in museums today, there is little evidence that they were ever employed in large numbers.

h4. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[sawed-off shotgun|Sawn-off shotgun]]

title: ninomiya_fumiya
body: A [[hourou_musuko|Hourou Musuko]] character. He is a teenage boy who discovers an interest in [[crossdressing]] after seeing Shuichi presenting as feminine.

title: nitori_shuuichi
body:
One of the central characters of [[hourou_musuko|Hourou Musuko]]. She is a teenage transgender girl, who is able to present as female throughout childhood due to her androgynous appearance. However, as puberty begins, she is less able to dress femininely without consequences.

One day, she works up the courage to wear a female uniform to school, which disgusts her classmates and causes them to ridicule her and call her a pervert.

Despite puberty making it increasingly harder for her to present as female, she still knows deep down that she wants to, and [spoilers]eventually confesses to her girlfriend that she wants to transition to female. Anna accepts her, knowing that this is what's right for Shuichi.[/spoilers]

She eventually takes on the female name Yuri (or Lily, in English).

title: oseledets
body: A traditional Ukrainian style of [[tag_group:hair_styles|haircut]] that features a long lock of hair left on the otherwise completely [[bald|shaved head]], commonly sprouting from the top or the front of an otherwise closely shaven head. Most commonly it is associated with the [[Ukrainian text|Ukrainian]]  [[cossack]]s, although first mentions of the haircut go back to "Sviatoslav I":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sviatoslav_I]. Also known as [b]чуб[/b] [[i]chub[/i]]

title: takatsuki_yoshino
body:
One of the central characters of [[hourou_musuko|Hourou Musuko]]. He is a teenage transgender boy who struggles with gender dysphoria, and the first person to befriend Shuichi. He is harassed by the other boys in his class due to their perception of him as a [[tomboy]].

He wore the male uniform to school for a little while until puberty started and he recieved ridicule from classmates, so he began to wear the female uniform instead to avoid drawing attention to himself, as well as to show support for Shuichi, who was not allowed to wear the female uniform she wanted to.

In the manga as life goes on, [spoilers]he is worn down by social pressures, and begins to internally question his gender identity. He constantly tries to reaffirm his masculinity, but eventually gives up, due to being exhausted from years of fear and rejection. He is noted to still consider himself a man deep down, and that transitioning would be the best path for him, but he lacks any motivation or strength to actually pursue it.[/spoilers]

title: oozora_hibari
body:
The main character of [[Stop!! Hibari-kun!]]. She is a transgender girl who is disdained by her father for her feminine presentation. She dresses as a woman full time, including at school, longs for larger breasts, and despises being seen as a man. She is extremely strong and can hold her own in practically any fight.

She falls in love with [[Sakamoto Kousaku]], who rejects her upon finding out her biological sex. Nonetheless, she continues to tease him.

According to the author in a "French interview":[https://www.radiofrance.fr/franceculture/podcasts/le-rayon-bd/stop-hibari-kun-un-manga-pop-transgenre-et-dejante-4595592], he chose to portray a trans character due to transgender people being much less known in Japan in the 80s, which gave him a lot of freedom in how he could portray the character.

Conviction, also known as the Boxing Artist, is a figure from legends and historical stories, said to have been from the ancient country of Agamemnon.

During the beta testing of Arknights, Conviction was playable as a 4-star Specialist operator, with skills capable of pushing enemy units (much like [[shaw (arknights)|Shaw]] and [[feater (arknights)|FEater]]). They were scrapped prior to the final release of the game, for reasons unknown. They were officially reintroduced into the game on April Fools 2020, reclassed as a Guard operator. Their skill set was reworked to be dependent on RNG.

Their motif is based on the Indian peafowl.

Their [[voice actor]]s are [[Yamaoka Yuri]] (Japanese), Ying Xie (Chinese), Jad Saxton (English), and Kim Hyeon-sim (Korean). Their art designer is [[tomato (lsj44867)|TOMATO]].

title: parasite
body:
A type of organism that is inhabiting a host (other organism)'s body, either by getting inside their body through some means or attached themselves to the host. Parasite usually sustain themselves by using the host's body to gather nutrient, reproduce inside their body, and living there, typically at the host's expense (such as increased vulnerability to disease or even death).

Parasites often comes in a form of a [[worm]], though many other types of parasitic creature exists, with different preference for hosts.

On Danbooru, parasite refers to when one creature has "attached" themselves to the host and is clearly visible within that image, not just the traditional concept of parasites. This can also be applied to posts where a creature is being [[possessed]] by other organic beings attached to them.

h4. See also
* [[Barnacle]]
* [[Cordyceps]]
* [[Leucochloridium paradoxum]]
* [[Living clothes]]
* [[Migi (kiseijuu)|]]

In Tokyopop's North American version, his name was Shin. In 2014 anime series, he wears [[glasses]] and a [[blazer]] at first.

title: vine_explosion_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a video of an explosive disposal operation in Utah, United States in 2011. The [[explosion]] was first popularized as an [[explosion gag]] punchline on various [[Vine (company)|]] short videos, before making resurgence in 2020s in various Youtube shitposting video.

title: moriah_(chronicles_of_mystara)
body: The Thief character from [[Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles Of Mystara]], one of the two [[Dungeons & Dragons]] games that [[Capcom]] produced. Like all Thief characters from the Basic versions of D&D, she can use any one-handed melee weapon and all ranged weapons, knows how to use many special abilities unique to thieves, and does her best damage from behind.
other_names: モリア(シャドーオーバーミスタラ)

title: kayla_(chronicles_of_mystara)
body: Kayla is the Elf character from the [[Capcom]] [[Dungeons & Dragons]] games. Like all elves from Basic D&D, she can act as a fighter and a magic-user in equal measure, unlike human characters who generally have to choose one or the other.

title: lucia_(chronicles_of_mystara)
body: Lucia is the Elf character of the Capcom [[Dungeons & Dragons]] games. Like all elves in Basic D&D, she can use weapons and fight much like a fighter can, and she can cast spells like a magic user as well.
other_names: ルシア(ミスタラ英雄戦記)

title: syous
body: The Magic-User character from [[Dungeons & Dragons: Chronicles Of Mystara]], one of the two [[Dungeons & Dragons]] games that [[Capcom]] produced. Like all Magic-User characters from the Basic versions of D&D, he can use daggers(his main weapon being a staff though, which is an optional weapon in the Basic game) and knows a broad range of spells, most being offensive in theme.

title: sakagami_ayumi
body:
A [[Precure All Stars]] series exclusive character, specifically, one of the central characters of the New Stage trilogy. She debuted in [[precure all stars new stage: mirai no tomodachi|New Stage 1]], being the central character of that movie, and later made some cameos in other All Stars installments.

A shy girl who has trouble making friends until she encounters a small creature named [[Fuu-chan (precure)|]]. She became [[Cure Echo]] at the end of [[precure all stars new stage: mirai no tomodachi|NS1]]. She became partners with fairies [[En'en]] and [[Gureru]] in [[precure all stars new stage 3: Eien no tomodachi|New Stage 3]].

Due to the fact that Ayumi debuted in the year of [[Smile Precure!]], Smile missing a mid-season Cure and she has the Smile logo on her front bow the same way the Smile Cures do, she is considered the pseudo-mid-season-Cure of the Smile generation.

title: poi
body:
[[Yuudachi (kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]]'s catchphrase-poi.

To be used only when there is particular emphasis on the phrase "poi" (when used standalone, "poi" is in romaji, a pun, etc...) and the use is related in some way to Yuudachi, not just as a comparative particle of sorts-poi.

Not to be confused with the [[poi_(goldfish_scoop)|festival goldfish scoop]], [[poi_(object)|the tethered weights]] (sometimes lit) used in the eponymous performance art, the polynesian staple food, [[poi_(last_origin)|a certain cat-eared maid from a certain mobile game]] or even the 3d adventure platformer game-poi. It's also not to be confused with the onomatopeia for throwing a light object-poi.

title: transformers
body:
[quote][i]"MORE THAN MEETS THE EYE...!!!"[/i] - Official slogan.[/quote]

A [[science fiction]] franchise from the [[1980s_(style)|80s]] and onwards that started as a popular line of transforming [[robot]] action figures produced by "Takara (Tomy)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomy and [[Hasbro]].

In 1984, American toy company Hasbro licensed the Japanese [i][[Diaclone]] Car Robots[/i] toyline (1982) along with the Japanese [i][[Microman]] "Micro Change":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Micro_Change [/i]toyline (1982) from Takara and merged both series of toys to create many of the original Transformers. Takara eventually discontinued the Diaclone and Microman toylines in 1985 in favor of the Transformers rebranding in Japan.

The [[Marvel]] [[comic]]s company also contributed to the original franchise by developing the whole fictional Generation 1 universe of the series and its robot characters info and backgrounds, all created by Marvel comics writer "Bob Budiansky":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Budiansky. It also published a comic book adaptation of the series during the 80s and 90s.

Due to its great success, [i]Transformers[/i] has been adapted into many animated TV shows, an animated movie, and six live-action movies.

This tag is for the series as a whole. For the original 1984 series, see [[Transformers: Generation 1]].

title: ryu_lion
body:
A character in [[Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka|DanMachi]]. She is also the protagonist of the Familia Chronicle: Episode Ryu and the Astraea Record light novel series.

Ryu tries to live up to the ideals of justice on account of her former familia, is frequently strict in her interactions with others on account of her [[elf|elven]] heritage, and generally does not allow others to touch her. She has some [[kuudere]] elements early on, but grows out of this as her character develops. During her time with the Astraea familia, she is depicted as being more hotheaded, in contrast with her current, more stoic self.

Ryu is an [[elf]] with [[tsurime|tsurime-shaped]] [[blue|sky blue eyes]] and [[blonde hair|golden-blonde hair]], which is typically [[green hair|dyed light green]] and maintained [[short hair|short]] in a [[wavy hair|wavy pattern]] with [[long bangs]] and [[sidelocks]] by her co-worker [[Syr Flover|Syr]] at the Hostess of Fertility. Prior to joining the bar, she kept her hair at [[long hair|waist length]]. Later on in the series, she stops dyeing her hair and starts to regrow it again.

Ryu's workplace attire consists of a [[long dress|long]] [[green dress]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and an [[orange ribbon]], a [[maid apron|white maid apron]] with matching [[maid headdress]], and [[black thighhighs|black tights]] with [[ankle boots|brown ankle boots]]. When out adventuring, she typically wears a [[green cape|long green cape]] with a [[hood|flower-shaped hood]] over a [[tank top|white tank top]] with a [[cross-laced slit]] the sides. She occasionally wears a [[green mask|green]] [[mouth mask]] to hide her identity. She is typically depicted as wearing [[short shorts|short]] [[green shorts]] that are similar in appearance to [[buruma]]. She wears a pair of [[thigh boots|long brown thigh boots]] with matching [[elbow gloves]]. She wields a [[wooden sword|long wooden sword]] alongside a pair of [[kodachi]] that she keeps sheathed by her waist.

h4. External links

* "DanMachi Wiki: Ryuu Lion":https://danmachi.fandom.com/wiki/Ryuu_Lion

title: yamato_mikoto
body:
A [[dungeon ni deai wo motomeru no wa machigatteiru darou ka|DanMachi]] character. Yamato is a member of the [[Hestia]] Familia and a former member of the Takemikazuchi Familia.

Mikoto has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] which she has tied in a [[side ponytail|ponytail]] with [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[short kimono|short]] [[purple kimono]] with a [[sarashi]] underneath along with a dark [[red sash]] and [[thigh boots|thigh-length boots]]. She also wears a [[shoulder armor|red shoulder guard]] on her nonweapon arm, [[japanese armor|arm guards]], and keeps her [[katana]] in the [[sheath|sash]] at her waist. Mikoto has a serious and honorable personality, unwilling to use cowardly tactics in combat.

Her name is a possible reference to the Japanese folk hero "Yamato Takeru no Mikoto":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamato_Takeru.

h4. External links

* "DanMachi Wiki: Yamato Mikoto":https://danmachi.fandom.com/wiki/Yamato_Mikoto

title: arene_(arknights)
body:
[i]Vanguard Operator Arene, always taking pleasure in toying with his enemies on the field.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]6 months[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

An adolescent infected Sankta serving as Rhodes Island operator.

Uncharactersistically, he doesn't wield a firearm like the other Sankta, rather he prefers using a staff imbued with toxic and corrosive Arts. His body carries a faint fragrance that could either be harmless or toxic.

He studied in Leithanien with [[Eyjafjalla (arknights)|]]. Him and [[Insider (arknights)|]] know each other.

He has a nonchalant attitude and likes to play pranks on people. He also has a mildly sadistic side that shows itself occasionally. He won't listen to adults if he finds them boring.

His [[voice actor]]s are Yoshitsugu Matsuoka (Japanese), Feng Xiu (Chinese), and Lee Kyung-tae (Korean).

h4. Skins
* [[arene_(casual)_(arknights)|Casual]]
* [[arene_(dangerous_invitation)_(arknights)|Dangerous Invitation]]
other_names: アレーン(アークナイツ)

title: bell_cranel
body:
Bell is the main male protagonist of [[dungeon ni deai wo motomeru no wa machigatteiru darou ka|DanMachi]] and the captain of the [[Hestia]] Familia.

He is a young teenager with [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]], often compared to a rabbit based on his appearance. He prefers wearing lightweight [[armor]] and wears a hip-length [[brown coat]] with a small black patch on the right side above his chest along with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] underneath. He also wears [[black pants]], a beige [[belt]] with a silver [[belt buckle|buckle]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. Bell is a kind, straightforward, brave, yet shy boy.

h4. External links

* "DanMachi Wiki: Bell Cranel":https://danmachi.fandom.com/wiki/Bell_Cranel

title: welf_crozzo
body:
A [[dungeon ni deai wo motomeru no wa machigatteiru darou ka|DanMachi]] character. Welf Crozzo is a member of the [[Hestia]] Familia and [[Bell Cranel]]'s personal smith, later becoming one for the entire Hestia Familia after converting from the Hephaestus Familia.

Welf is a tall adult male who has [[short hair|short]], [[spiked hair|spik]] [[red hair]] and dark [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[blue scarf]] around his neck. His attire consists of a dark [[blue shirt|blue]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] shirt underneath a [[black kimono]] with a [[brown belt]] tied around his waist along with tanned [[white pants]] and long [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]]. Welf is a straightforward and honest person.

h4. External links

* "DanMachi Wiki: Welf Crozzo":https://danmachi.fandom.com/wiki/Welf_Crozzo

Real Name: Leontuzzo Bellone

h4. Profile

Secretary for the Ministry of Public Works of Volsinii and heir of the mafia Family Bellone. [[Texas (arknights)|]] is assigned as his bodyguard to help him against other [i]famiglie[/i] to gain hegemony of a newly built nomadic city.

He is one of the protagonists of the side story [i]Il Siracusano[/i].

His [[voice actor]]s are [[Kenn_(voice_actor)_|KENN]] (Japanese), Zhang Tongming (Chinese), Salvatore Scarpa (English), Lee Sangho (Korean), and Alessandro Pili (Italian). His art designer is [[hou (ppo)|hou]].

title: tomy_company_ltd.
body:
A Japanese children's toys and merchandise company.

They merged with Takara Co., Ltd. in 2006, and traded under the names [b]Takara Tomy[/b] in Asia and [b]Tomy[/b] elsewhere.

h4. Notable brands owned or co-owned by Tomy

* [[Duel Masters]] (Co-developed by Wizards of the Coast/[[Hasbro]])
* [[Pretty series]]
* [[Wixoss]]
* [[Zoids]]
* from Takara
** [[Beyblade]]
** [[B-Daman]]
** [[Choro-Q]]
** [[The Game of Life (board game)]]
** [[Transformers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tomy":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomy]

title: choro-q
body:
A line of small pull-back [[toy car]]s by [[tomy company ltd.|Takara]], known as [b]Penny Racers[/b] in America. Choro-Q cars are notable for their exaggerated [[chibi]] style and are primarily based off real world vehicles.

The toyline has been adapted into a number of video games, and has had collaborations with several popular franchises including [[Initial D]], [[Wangan Midnight]], [[Fast & Furious]], and [[Transformers]].

title: zoids
body: A toy line of [[mecha|giant robotic]] animals by [[tomy company ltd.|Takara-Tomy]]. It has four anime series with various spin-offs and adaptions. It also has an overarching battle story which is continued on each new Zoids model box.

title: the_game_of_life_(board_game)
body:
[i]The Game of Life[/i] is an American board game from the 1960s, which was in turn based on an 1860 board game called [i]The Checkered Game of Life[/i], developed by Milton Bradley. The 20th-century version replaces the original game's checkerboard-patterned game board with one that has spaces arranged to suggest a meandering road--a metaphor for the course of a person's life--along which players move tokens shaped like cars. Each turn, a player's token moves a number of spaces dictated by a numerical spinner built into the board. Printed outcomes on each space may have positive or negative consequences. Further complications have been introduced in successive editions of the game, but the ultimate goal remains to reach the end of the road (which the game's "life" metaphor defines as retirement) with the most money.

In Japan, [[tomy company ltd.|Takara]] released a translated version of the original in 1968. Since 1983, the game has developed independently from the original.

title: duel_masters
body:
A Japanese trading card game franchise. Developed by Wizards of the Coast and [[tomy company ltd.|Takara Tomy]] (the former a subsidiary of [[Hasbro]]) as a Japanese adaptation of [[Magic: the Gathering]].

The original card game was produced from 2002 to 2006 in the US and to 2012 in Japan. It was later relaunched in 2014 in Japan only. It has spawned several manga, anime, and video games, and continues to do so to this day.

h4. See also
* [[Duel Masters Play's]]
other_names: デュエル・マスターズ

title: beyblade
body:
[b]Beyblade[/b] (Japanese: ベイブレード, Beiburēdo) is an acclaimed multimedia franchise brand created by Japanese toy company [[tomy company ltd.|Takara Tomy]]. The franchise surrounds high-performance spinning tops known as the eponymous "Beyblades", which are customizable and are played by people called "Bladers" who challenge others to games called "Beybattles". Beyblade is also the name of multiple anime and manga series concerning a group of children who form teams with which they battle with their Beyblades.

h4. Media
* [[Bakuten Shoot Beyblade]] (2001, 2002/V-Force, and G-Revolution)
* [[Metal Fight Beyblade]] (Metal Fight/Metal Fusion, Baku/Metal Masters, 4D/Metal Fury, and Zero-G/Shogun Steel)
* [[Beyblade: Burst]]
* [[Beyblade X]]

h4. External links
* "Beyblade Official Website":[http://www.beyblade.com/]
* "Wikipedia: Beyblade":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beyblade]

title: defensive_wall
body:
A fortification usually used to protect a [[city]], [[town]] or other settlement from potential aggressors. The walls can range from simple palisades or earthworks to extensive military fortifications with [[tower]]s, bastions and gates for access to the city. They are commonly seen in [[medieval]] settings. One of the real life examples is the [[Great Wall of China]].

title: at4
body:
A [[sweden|Swedish]] 84 mm unguided, disposable, shoulder-fired anti-tank [[weapon|recoilless rifle]] built by Saab Bofors Dynamics. Technically it is not considered a [[rocket launcher]] as the [[explosive]] warhead is not propelled by a rocket motor, and the weapon itself has rifled barrel. Also known as M136 in [[united states|US Army]] service.

The name AT4 is a [[pun|word play]] on the 84 mm caliber of the weapon. 'Eighty four' being a homophone of 'A-T-4'. The name also doubles as an alpha-phonetic word play on the weapon's role due to "AT" being a common military abbreviation for "Anti-Tank".

h4. See also
* [[AT4 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: AT4":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AT4
* "Youtube: AT4 Anti-Tank Weapon":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3xsMqHu56g

title: type_56_assault_rifle
body:
Chinese: 56式突击步枪, '[[Assault Rifle]], Model of 1956'. A series of Chinese-produced [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] copies based on the [[AK-47]] and [[AKM]]. Production started in 1956 and continues to be used by various nations today. Easily distinguished from its original [[Soviet]] counterparts by its fully enclosed front sight, and all types are lacking side mount plates for attaching [[optical sight|optics]]. Also often has a folding spike [[bayonet]]. The receiver for early models can be milled or stamped.

h4. Major variants
* !post #6264963: Type 56 - AK-47 clone with a fixed stock and permanently attached [[bayonet]].
* !post #2223228: Type 56-1 - With [[folding stock|underfolding stock]] but the bayonet can be present or not. 
* !post #3173945: Type 56-2 - With stamped receiver and side-folding stock. (two on the middle)

h4. See also
* [[Type 56-1 (Girls' Frontline)]] 
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links
* "China vs Russia: whose AKs are better?":[https://www.rbth.com/science-and-tech/330170-china-vs-russia-ak] ("comparison image":[https://mf.b37mrtl.ru/rbthmedia/images/2019.03/original/5c9de36f85600a44c256f6a2.jpg], asset #21985260)
* Wikipedia article: "Type 56 assault rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_56_assault_rifle

title: fim-92_stinger
body:
A US-developed man-portable surface-to-air [[rocket launcher|missile system]] (MANPADS). Normally shoulder-fired by a single operator, it can be adapted for use against [[helicopter]]s and [[military vehicle|ground vehicle]]s. It entered service in 1981 and is used by the [[military|militaries]] of the [[United States]] and 29 other countries. Principally manufactured by "Raytheon Missiles & Defense":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raytheon_Missiles_%26_Defense].

The use of supplied Stingers by Mujahideen gunners during the [[war in afghanistan|Soviet-Afghan War]] was responsible for most Soviet aircraft losses.

h4. See also
* [[FGM-148 Javelin]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[St. Javelin]]
h4. External links
* "Directory of US Rockets and Missiles: FIM-92":http://www.designation-systems.net/dusrm/m-92.html
* "Wikipedia: FIM-92 Stinger":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIM-92_Stinger]

title: agemasen!_(meme)
body:
"You can't have it!"
"I'm not giving it to you!"

[[Special Week (Umamusume)|]]'s memetic phrase occurring in an imagine spot in Season 2 Episode 11 of the [[Umamusume]] anime. 

May be used when Special Week literally refuses to hand something over (carrots), or memed further in the context of the [[Umamusume]] game when Special Week refuses to hand down a specific "skill" that the player desires. 

Other characters may also join in the fun, particularly those who are descendants of Special Week in real life, using similar phrasing and/or poses.

h4. External links
* "Original scene from S2E11 of the Umamusume anime":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZTw0CI-Lgjk]
* "Modified memed version of the above, alluding to the Umamusume game skill inheritance mechanics":[https://youtu.be/2flT5z3NtOc]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: あげません!":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%82%E3%81%92%E3%81%BE%E3%81%9B%E3%82%93!]

title: corset_piercing
body:
A type of [[body piercings|body piercing]] that consists of multiple piercings in rows, with [[ribbon]], [[string]] or [[chain]]s laced through to mimic the appearance of a [[corset]], though it can be worn anywhere on the body. 

Think [[cross-laced clothes]], but it's directly on the skin instead.

In real life, these piercings are only intended to be temporary; they are rarely worn for more than a week. As such, they're typically done for short-term activites, such as a photo-shoot.

They may also be done as a form of piercing play in [[BDSM]].

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Piercings]]

title: kaoruko_sayaka
body:
A character who appeared in ND's "HifuuRin Club":[https://www.nicovideo.jp/series/61282] ("秘封霖倶楽部") series.

A rich young lady who serves as the student council president of the university that Rinnosuke and the others attend.

Though she uses polite language, her personality is vulgar, and she doesn't seem to leave a very good impression on the other characters. She generally has a lot of free time, but when that free time is lost for some reason, she cries. And she cries loudly.

She was adopted by a wealthy man who loves dolls, and whether this has influenced her or she's always been like that, she loves the dolls in her house, and she is especially concerned about the doll she calls "Kaede".

She is skilled in many things, not only in her studies, but also in her driving and observation skills.
However, as can be seen from her personality, she rarely uses them for good deeds, and basically uses them according to her desires.

Other characters generally refer to her as "president" or "pervert," and few call her by her name like the main character, Rinnosuke.

She seems to be starving for love, and since her appearance she has been involved with Rinnosuke many times, and each time she does something to bother him.

title: komada_suzumi
body:
A character who appeared in ND's HifuuRin Club ("秘封霖倶楽部") series.

A friend of Rinnosuke's who often teases him at university. Although she is a woman, she has masculine behavior and appearance, and has many female fans on campus. She has a younger sister who is a middle school student named Kyoko. She is skilled in martial arts, and shows a decent fighting ability when in a pinch.

title: haseda_yui
body:
A character who appeared in ND's HifuuRin Club ("秘封霖倶楽部") series.

A member of the unofficial university newspaper club, she publishes a newspaper. She is only as tall as an elementary school student, wears glasses and has her hair in a braid.

Contrary to her passive appearance, she has a bright personality and speaks eloquently with a sense of justice in her paper. She is also very enthusiastic about reporting.

title: kiriya_masumi
body:
A character who appeared in ND's HifuuRin Club ("秘封霖倶楽部") series.

A member of the university library committee. When Rinnosuke asks her where a book is, she can answer immediately, so she seems to remember exactly where every book is. She shares the same hobby of reading as Rinnosuke, and since they both have a wealth of knowledge, they seem to be able to talk about even complicated things. However, despite giving intellectual-sounding book titles, in the story, her knowledge leaves much to be desired.

title: i_am_your_father_(meme)
body:
[quote][i]"NO...!!! I AM YOUR FATHER...!!!"[/i] - Darth Vader to Luke Skywalker in [i]The Empire Strikes Back[/i][/quote]

A [[meme]] originated from the most famous scene in [[Star Wars]]: [[star wars: the empire strikes back|The Empire Strikes Back]].

The scene revolves [[Darth Vader]] and [[Luke Skywalker]] fighting with their [[lightsaber]]s, when Vader manages to cut off Luke's right hand and forced him to the corner. Vader then revealed that he is, in fact, [[Anakin Skywalker|his father]] whom Luke was told that had died long time ago. This culminated into Luke screaming and crying out of disbelief, anguish and agony.

Contrary to popular belief, Vader never says the name Luke during his quote.

title: animal_ear_fluff
body:
A distinct soft-looking fuzz that protrudes from the inside of [[animal ears]]. It is usually white in colouration, often resembling tufts of cotton, but can also take the form of swept fur that is faded in color.

Most common with [[fox ears]], but can be present in any type of [[animal ears]].

This tag may be used for actual [[animal]]s' ears as well.

h4. Examples

* !post #2571503: Cotton ball ear fluff
* !post #6858228: Ear fluff in [[cat ears]]
* !post #2506649: Ear fluff in [[rabbit ears]]
* !post #4498248: A character who is commonly drawn with prominent ear fluff

h4. See also

* [[Animal ears]]
* [[kemonomimi mode]]

title: ash_(titanfall_2)
body:
An antagonist character from [[Titanfall 2]]. She is a [[simulacrum (titanfall)|]] allied with [[Kuben Blisk]]'s Apex Predators and pilots a [[Ronin (titanfall 2)|]]. In the game's multiplayer she leads the Vinson Dynamics faction into battle.

She later reappeared in [[Apex Legends]] as an event character during Season 5, was added to the game permanently as the announcer for Arenas in Season 9, and became a playable legend with a new design in Season 11. In the leadup to Season 11, she was revealed to have originally been Dr. [[Ashleigh Reid]].

In both of her appearances, Ash is an [[android]] with a fully mechanical body and a human-like [[metal skin|metal face]]. In her TF2 appearance she has [[solid eyes|solid]] [[black eyes]], and only wears a grey [[hood]].

In her default Apex appearance she has [[yellow eyes]] with [[black sclera]] and wears a [[blue leotard|blue]] [[hooded leotard]]. Her metal face is [[cracked skin|cracked]] in this appearance, and she wields a [[sword]] used to cast her ultimate ability. After having her original Ashleigh persona reawakened by [[Horizon (apex legends)|]], Ash has a [[dual persona|double personality]], though she mostly finds Ashleigh to be a nuisance she wants silenced.

Ash's heirloom weapon is the [[Strongest Link (apex legends)|]], and she is often portrayed alongside an [[ash's rat (apex legends)|unnamed rat]] that she keeps as a companion.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7332818: In [[Titanfall 2]]
* !post #7361100: In [[Apex Legends]] (default skin)

title: aqua_(konosuba)
body:
Aqua is a character in [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!]]

She was a Water Goddess (hence her name) who governed the souls of those who have passed until the eventful day where she met [[Satou Kazuma]], whom she is forced to join through a plot by Kazuma, spawning in a ''MMORPG'' like world with him. She also becomes one of Satou Kazuma's unreliable party members as an arch-priest, joined with [[Megumin]] & [[Darkness (konosuba)|]].

[spoiler]Has outstanding stats except for her luck and intelligence, which are both not only below average, but also has zero growth during level up.
Her worshipers are infamous for being "odd in the head". Also, apparently she is really not all that famous as she claimed to be, since most people in the ''MMORPG'' like world worships [[Eris (konosuba)|Eris]] instead of her.
[/spoiler]

Aqua has [[blue eyes]], noticeable [[breasts]] and [[ass]], and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[bangs]] & a [[single hair ring|hair ring]] held by a blue [[hair ornament]]. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[blue shirt|blue]] [[shirt]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] showing her [[bare shoulders]], a [[choker]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[skirt]], blue [[gem]], [[green bow|green]] [[bow]], and [[white thighhighs]] [[thighhighs under boots|over her]] [[blue footwear|blue]] [[thigh boots]].

Rather famously, she seemingly [[no panties|never wears panties]] in the anime, whereas she is clearly shown to wear underwear in both the light novel and the manga.

h4. See also
* [[Crying Aqua (meme)]]

Note: [b][i]Major spoiler warning![/i][/b] 

[spoiler]She is the tragic result of [[Miki Sayaka]] becoming a Witch.

Also becomes a [[stand (jojo)|stand-like]] entity for Sayaka in the [[mahou shoujo madoka magica: hangyaku no monogatari|Rebellion movie]].[/spoiler]

title: epe-tohri
body:
Artist known for her [[Dragon Ball]] [[Female Majin]] original character, Majin Lamp. Officially closed her dA account and left the DB fandom in late 2014 after disappearing for three years due to frustrations of people using art of her previously mentioned OC and reusing it for their own characters.

As of 2024, she appears to have returned under the name Tsugikabo. However, she is prone to deleting works due to fears of AI training being used on them.

title: mie_goreng
body: An Indonesian style of often spicy fried noodles that is common in Indonesia and has spread to Malaysia, Singapore and Brunei Darussalam. It is made by stir-frying thin yellow [[noodles]] in cooking oil with [[vegetable]]s such as [[garlic]], [[onion]]s, [[spring onion|scallion]]s, fried [[shrimp]], [[chicken]], [[beef]], bakso slices, [[chili pepper]]s, Chinese cabbage, [[cabbage]], [[tomato]]es, and [[egg]]s.

title: hearts_(dragon_ball)
body:
A mysterious man in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]] than can read the minds of other people at will. He initially appeared as another person roped into [[fu_(dragon_ball)|Fu's]] experiments, but used this to pursue his goals of ridding the universe of all godly beings.

[Spoilers] Later in the series, he becomes an ally to [[Son Goku]] and his friends alongside [[Cumber]]. Despite this, he is shown to still aspire to erase all gods from the universe. [/spoilers]
other_names: ハーツ(ドラゴンボール)

title: chronoa
body:
Character from the [[Dragon Ball]] game series.

The Supreme Kai of Time of Universe 7, she was first mentioned in [[Dragon Ball Online]], and made her first appearance in the first [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]]. Her proper name was revealed as Chronoa in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]]. Officially, she has two forms - her regular petite form (post #1956366) and her larger Power of Time Unleashed form (post #3929894) - but one of her [[prototype design|concept art]] "designs":[https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EYe0kETU0AApEn1.jpg:orig] is also popular among fanartists. 

[[trunks (future) (dragon ball)|Future Trunks]] serves as her [[trunks (future) (xeno) (dragon ball)|assistant]] in the [[Time Patrol (dragon ball)|]].

[Spoilers]She briefly becomes mind-controlled by [[Mechikabura]] in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]], giving her two additional designs with red bandages and red eyes, like in (post #7800654) [/spoilers]
other_names: クロノア(ドラゴンボール)
時の界王神(時の力解放)

title: mechikabura
body:
A former rival to [[Chronoa]] and the leader of most of the [[demon]]s in [[Dragon Ball Heroes]]. He initially appeared as an old man, but used the [[dragon_ball_(object)|dragon balls]] to make himself younger. He is often referred to as the "Dark King" and is the original creator of [[dogidogi_(dragon_ball)|Dogidogi]]. 
[spoilers]Following his supposed death, he often appears in the conscience of whoever is given his "Dark King" powers in an effort to find a new body to control. He has yet to succeed.[/spoilers]

body:

Collar tabs sign the [[military rank insignia|military insignia]] (group of ranks), the rank of civil service, the military unit, the office (department) or the branch of armed forces and the arm of service.

title: time_patrol_(dragon_ball)
body: The Time Patrol is an organization that was originally introduced in [[Dragon Ball Online]] and plays prominent roles in the succeeding games [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]] and [[Dragon Ball Heroes]]. The organization is commanded by [[Chronoa]], the Supreme Kai of Time, and seeks to correct errors in history that could cause catastrophic harm to the balance of time and space. Well-known characters that are officially employed by the Time Patrol are [[Trunks (Future) (Xeno) (Dragon Ball)|Trunks (Xeno)]], [[Son Goku (Xeno)]], [[Vegeta (Xeno)]], [[mirai senshi]], [[Son Gohan (Xeno)]], and [[Pan (xeno) (dragon ball)|Pan (Xeno)]], as well as many more.

title: dallara_dw12
body:
A [[formula racer]] chassis designed by [[racecar]] manufacturer Dallara for the [[Indycar Series]]. The DW12 debuted in 2012 and is still used in Indycar competition, having received updates including updated aerodynamics, the addition of a windscreen, and a hybrid system.

The DW12 is powered by engines sourced from either [[Honda]] or [[Chevrolet]], depending on the race team's manufacturer affiliation.

h4. Examples
* !post #7256851: A 2013-spec DW12
* !post #7645951: A post-2018 DW12 with the Aeroscreen

title: shin_megami_tensei:_strange_journey
body:
Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey (真・女神転生 ストレンジジャーニー, lit. "True Goddess Reincarnation: Strange Journey") is the fourth game in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] series. It would later be remade as [[Shin Megami Tensei: Deep Strange Journey]].

In the story, a black hole suddenly appears in the South Pole, and is expanding rapidly. Concerned, the United Nations sends a team composed of soldiers and researchers from all over the world to explore and investigate the anomaly, dubbed "Schwarzwelt". However, upon arrival, the investigation team discovers that the area is inhabited by [[demon]]s.

The player controls an unnamed American soldier (Japanese in the original version), and must then make choices that might affect the future of humanity.

h4. Characters

* [[Tadano Hitonari]] (Protagonist)
* [[Zelenin (strange journey)|Zelenin]]
* [[Jimenez (strange journey)|Jimenez]]
* [[Commander Gore]]

h4. See also

* [[Shin Megami Tensei I]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei II]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei III: Nocturne]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: if...]]
other_names: 真・女神転生ストレンジジャーニー
ストレンジジャーニー

title: seikan_hikou
body:
"Interstellar Flight", is a song sung by [[Ranka Lee]] in [[Macross Frontier]] episode 12. Also her debut single.

In the context of this site, refers to pictures mimicking the three-fingered, sparkle-eyed position she takes when she sings the chorus (see post #280239), which was also used as the cover art for the song's single release. This position uses the [[\m/]] キラッ☆ hand gesture. Make sure the image is specifically referring to Macross Frontier, as [b]not[/b] every character doing a \m/ pose is parodying Ranka.

h4. Examples
* !post #7800373: The single album cover
* !post #262715: Official illustration of Ranka and other characters doing the pose

title: ginga_eiyuu_densetsu
body:
[b]Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu[/b] (銀河英雄伝説, lit. "Legend of the Galactic Heroes", also known as [i]Gin'ei den[/i] or [i]LOTGH[/i]) is a series of science fiction novels written by [[Tanaka Yoshiki]], detailing the conflict between the [[galactic_empire_(gin'eiden)|Galactic Empire]] and the [[Free Planets Alliance]].

The series has received multiple adaptations, including an anime that aired from 1988 to 1997, two mangas, and several video games. A new anime adaptation aired in 2018, and a series of films is set to premiere in 2019.

h4. Nations and organizations

title: guido_mista
body:
A supporting character from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5: [[Vento Aureo]]. His [[Stand (jojo)|]] is [[Sex Pistols (stand)|]]. He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], often concealed by his distinctive [[hat]] with a downward-facing arrow design in the front, an [[argyle sweater]] that exposes his [[midriff]] as well as [[tiger print]] pants.

[[tetraphobia|Believes the number 4 is unlucky,]] and will go to great lengths to avoid any instance of it in his daily life. This is reflected in the numbering scheme of his Stand.

title: giorno_giovanna
body:
Main protagonist of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5: [[Vento Aureo]]. Illegitimate son of [[Dio Brando]] ([spoiler]with [[Jonathan Joestar]]'s body[/spoiler]) and an unnamed Japanese woman. Born [[Haruno Shiobana|Shiobana Haruno]] (汐華初流乃), early in his life his mother moved to Italy and married an Italian man, resulting in his name change. 

Has a distinctive hairstyle, blonde with three prominent hair curls in the front and a braided ponytail in back. Some fans jokingly liken his hair to chocolate cornets.

His [[stand (jojo)|Stand]] is [[Gold Experience]].
other_names: ジョルノ・ジョバアーナ

title: skeleton_flower_(plant)
body:
[b][i]Diphylleia grayi[/i][/b] (lit. double-leaf of Gray) is a species of [[flower]]ing plant of the genus [i]Diphylleia[/i] in the family [i]Berberidaceae[/i] (barberry family). It is known for its [[white flower]]s that become [[transparent flower|translucent]] in rain or high humidity, earning it the common name [i]skeleton flower[/i].

Diphylleia grayi flowers have six obovate white petals and six yellow stamens surrounding a green pistil in the center. After blooming, the flowers turn into blue to purple berries.

h5. Examples
* !asset #21948304: Photo reference: Before rain
* !asset #21948297: Photo reference: After rain
* !post #7602529

h4. See Also
* [[Ghost pipe (flower)|]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Diphylleia grayi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diphylleia_grayi
* "Wikipedia: Berberidaceae":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berberidaceae

title: ar-10
body:
The [b]AR-10[/b] is an [[united states|American]]-designed 7.62×51mm NATO [[battle rifle]], developed in 1955 by Eugene Stoner at ArmaLite. It was relatively lightweight due to its heavy use of aluminum and fiberglass furniture, yet also one of the most controllable in fully automatic fire due to its straight-line stock design. It was rejected by the [[united states army|US Army]] in favour of the [[M14]] and was used only by a handful of foreign [[military|militaries]]. 
* !post #6193600: Early AR-10 models with Bakelite handguard.
h4. See also
* [[AR-15]]
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[SR-25]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: ArmaLite AR-10":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ArmaLite_AR-10

title: thour_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] consisting of a [[2koma]] where a character tastes a [[lemon]], and subsequently [[puckered face|puckers their entire face]].

The trend started on May 4th, 2024, when Twitter artist and VTuber [[Ceno the Crocodile]] posted artwork of their crocodile character eating a lemon, captioning the piece "Thour.".

"Thour" is "[[sour (taste)|]]" pronounced with a lisp, as one would have with puckered lips.

h4. Origin

* !post #7573857: Post that started the trend.

h4. See also

* [[Eats a lemon and dies (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Thour 🍋":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/thour-%F0%9F%8D%8B]

title: glemy_toto
body:
A fictional antagonist character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]Glemy Toto[/b] is a [[blonde hair]]ed ambitious and young (but high ranking) [[military]] officer in [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. His [[mobile_suit|MS]] [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Bawoo]].

[spoilers]He eventually turns rogue and stars a rebellion against Haman Karn to gain control of Neo Zeon. Dies at the end of the series vaporized by an energy blast from [[Roux Louka]]'s [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]].[/spoilers]

title: film_reel
body:
A circular metal container composed of a central spool with which a [[film strip|strip of film]] is wrapped and side rims that help to retain the film. It can be inserted or affixed to a [[projector]] to play back video.  When not in use, a film reel may be stored in a metal [[film canister]].

Not to be confused with the similarly appearing [[magnetic tape]], a form of electronic data storage that may also be used on a reel.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Reel - Motion picture terminology":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reel#Motion_picture_terminology]

title: nontraditional_jika-tabi
body:
Various footwear inspired or derived from the Japanese [[jika-tabi]].  Visually distinct from the traditional jika-tabi by incorporating elements found in other styles of footwear.

Real world examples include the Nike Air Rift split-toe shoes and various footwear produced by French luxury fashion house Maison Margiela.

title: patlite
body:
Patlite is a character from [[NO MORE Eiga Dorobou]]. The name Patlite comes from "patrol light" since his head looks like a [[police_siren|siren light]] you might find on top of a patrol car.

Patlite attempts to catch [[Movie Thief]].

title: no_more_eiga_dorobou
body:
NO MORE Eiga Dorobou ("NO MORE Movie Thieves", or "NO MORE Movie Theft") is a series of messages that played nationwide in Japanese theaters before movies. The messages talk about the penalties for bootlegging a film or downloading music illegally. 

The messages star [[Movie Thief]], a dancing, suit-wearing man with a camera for a head. A narrator says,

"Filming and recording inside a theater is a crime. According to law, it is punishable by up to ten years imprisonment and/or fines of up to ten million yen. If you come across any suspicious conduct, please immediately report it to theater staff. The police will be notified at once. [b]No more movie thieves.[/b]"

h4. Characters 

* [[Movie Thief]] 
* [[Patlite]]


h4. See also 

* "Wikipedia on NO MORE 映画泥棒":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/NO_MORE_%E6%98%A0%E7%94%BB%E6%B3%A5%E6%A3%92 
* "Home page for the 映画盗撮防止キャンペーン (Movie Theft Prevention Campaign)":http://www.eigakan.org/legal/ 
* YouTube videos of the messages 
** http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bE5YhHn5WMI 
** http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0IY1XVCpIwQ 
** http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UX2SILlJo80

He is pursued by his nemesis, [[Patlite]].

title: ouji_masamune
body:
Ouji Masamune (王子 正宗 Ōji Masamune ?) is a supporting character from Suite Pretty Cure♪. He's a student in the third year of Private Aria Academy. He is popular with girls, particularly Kanade who has a crush on him. He's the school idol, and the leader of a group called the "Musical Princes", where he plays the piano.

Ouji is very committed to music, as he always strives to do better. He is also kindhearted and helpful, always going out of his way to help others.

title: chevreuse_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character. Born and raised in the Fleuve Cendre, the slums of the capital of Fontaine, she's now the Captain of the Special Security and Surveillance Patrol, whose scarce use of Gardemechs can be attributed to thinking they interfere with the Patrol's shooting skills. In her spare time, she likes reading works where justice prevails over evil, like crime novels, and has a fondness for junk food.

Her Vision element is Pyro, and she wields a polearm and a musket in battle.

Japanese CV: [[Shimoji Shino]]
English CV: [[Erica Lindbeck]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #6852009: Key Visual

Chevreuse has [[purple hair]] with [[crossed bangs]]. She wears an [[eyepatch]], and a [[shako cap]] for headwear. 
She wears a [[short dress|short]], [[strapless dress]], as well as a [[detached collar]] and [[detached sleeves]]. On her hands, she wears [[white gloves|white]] [[fold-over gloves|fold-over]] gloves.
For footwear, she wears [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]] with white [[thighhigh gaiters]].
She often weilds either a [[polearm]] or a [[musket]].

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Chevreuse":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Chevreuse]

title: gaiters
body:
A type of legwear worn over the [[shoes]] and [[pants tucked in|lower pantlegs]] to prevent rain, snow, or mud from getting in one's shoes. Gaiters can range in height from ankle-high to thighhigh. Gaiters sometimes have a strap that fits over the bottom of the shoe.

Not to be confused with [[legwear garter]] or [[garter straps]], which are bands or straps that keep legwear up.

* For the legwear worn over shoes for fashion, see [[spats (footwear)|]].

title: spats_(footwear)
body:
A type of footwear accessory that covers the instep and the ankles. Unlike [[gaiters]], spats are worn under the trousers.

Due to semantic drift, "spats" in Japanese actually refer to compression shorts or [[bike shorts]].

h4. See also

* [[bike shorts]] ("spats")

title: film_cartridge
body:
A tubular cartridge that contains a roll of [[film strip]], to be used in [[camera]]s.  They're typically sealed in a [[film canister]] when not in a camera or in use, as the cartridge has an opening on the side to let the film out and is thus not airtight.

Also known as a film cassette.

body:

Compared with Female Corrin's regular design, Nohr Noble features black becoming the outfit's most prominent color, Nohr Noble is also notable for now having [[cleavage]], and removing the [[kusazuri]]-like piece on her thigh, exposing her thighs from both the front and the back, making the outfit overall a lot more revealing.

title: zolo
body:
A fictional variable geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZM-S08G Zolo[/b]

The Zolo, like most of the [[Zanscare]] Empire's mass-production [[mobile suit]]s, is derived from the ZM-S06S [[Zoloat]]. Unlike the Zoloat which was designed for [[space]] combat, the Zolo is designed for combat on Earth, both on the ground and in the air. 

For that purpose, its thrusters and systems have been optimized for use under gravity and in the atmosphere allowing limited flight. The Zolo is also the first mass-produced mobile suit to utilize the beam rotor which is mounted on a hardpoint on either the left or right arm or a back-mounted hardpoint. First tested on the ZMT-S06G [[Zolorotor]], the beam rotor allows for more fuel efficient flight, and in mobile suit mode, doubles as a beam shield or a beam saw that can cut through any enemy mobile suits.

One of the Zolo's most significant features is its transformation system. Its torso can disconnect from the legs at the waist and transform into a helicopter/jet hybrid vehicle known as a Top Terminal. The waist and legs of the mobile suit become a Bottom Terminal that is remote controlled from the Top Terminal and relies on jet thrusters for propulsion. It can be outfitted with an anti-ground depth charge container to accompany the Top Terminal in bombing runs, and other missions that require dealing large amounts of damage to ground targets.

It was succeeded by the [[tomliat_(mecha)|Tomliat]].

title: tomliat_(mecha)
body:
A fictional variable geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZM-S09G Tomliat[/b]

A Zanscare Empire [[mobile suit]] developed from the ZM-S08G [[Zolo]]. When BESPA ([[Zanscare]] Imperial Army) determined the Zolo's transformation/separation system and its Top Terminal/Bottom Terminal combination was too inefficient for mobile suit combat, they began work on a replacement model. BESPA discarded the costly and complicated separation and docking system, and opted to utilize a single fast-transformation body.

title: sorceress_sellen
body:
[b]Sorceress Sellen[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is first found locked away within the bowels of the Waypoint Ruins. The [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] can choose to study magic under her tutelage, allowing them to buy spells from her.

[spoiler]The form you see in Waypoint Ruins is just a projection, as her true self is held prisoner in a the Witchbane Ruins. If the Tarnish chooses to help her, she will ask them to put her [b]Primal Glintstone[/b] into a new body. The Tarnish can choose to continue to help, or fight her, at the end of her questline. In either case, she ends up with a terrible fate. Should the player help her, she is transformed, along with her fellow conspirators, into a [[school of graven mages]], where she is barely able to speak.[/spoiler]

title: alecto_black_knife_ringleader
body:
[b]Alecto, Black Knife Ringleader[/b], is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is one of the [[Black Knife Assassin]]s and the [[mother and daughter|mother]] of [[black knife tiche|Tiche]].

She was [spoilers]the leader of the Assassins responsible for the Night of the Black Knives, where they [[murder]]ed [[Godwyn the Golden]].[/spoilers]

title: euphrati_keeler
body:
Euphrati Keeler was originally a Remembrancer during the final days of the Great Crusade aboard the Warmaster [[Horus_Lupercal|Horus]]' flagship Vengeful Spirit who would go on to be accalimed as the very first saint of the Imperial Cult.

Her experiences in the latter days of the [[Great Crusade]] transformed her from a normal young woman with no special abilities into a devoted believer in the divinity of the [[Emperor of Mankind]], a faith so deep that it would prove to be a supernatural bane to Daemons and other servants of [[Chaos_(Warhammer_40k)|Chaos]].

After the [[Horus Heresy]] began, Keeler would be recognised by others who shared her beliefs as a Living Saint, and the prophet of the Emperor. This reputation would see her later canonised as one of the first saints of the Imperial Cult and the Ecclesiarchy after the establishment of the Imperial state church in the mid-32nd Millennium.

She also wears [[heart-shaped eyewear|heart-shaped]] [[sunglasses]] with a [[blue-framed eyewear|blue frame]] and a [[purple-tinted eyewear|purple tint]].

title: h&k_usp
body:
The [b][[USP Compact (Girls' Frontline)|USP]][/b] ([i]Universelle Selbstladepistole[/i], "universal self-loading pistol") is a semi-automatic [[handgun]] developed and manufactured by [[Heckler & Koch]] since the early 1990s as a replacement for the [[H&K P7|P7]]. Available in a variety of calibers and variants. 

The [[weapon]] is recognizable by its large trigger guard and wide diagonal slide serrations.
This tag also include its minor variants such as the USP Match and the shorter USP Compact.

body:

A succession war between [[Rhaenyra Targaryen]]'s faction (Blacks) and [[Aegon II Targaryen]]'s faction (Greens).

title: infinite_stratos
body:
A 2009 light novel series by Yumizuru Izuru and illustrated by [[okiura]], later adapted adapted into a 2011 anime series by 8-Bit (with character designs by [[Kurashima Tomoyasu]]) and a manga serialized in Media Factory's [i]Monthly Comic Alive[/i], illustrated by Akahoshi Kenji.

15-year-old [[Orimura Ichika]] is discovered to be the only male capable of piloting an Infinite Stratos (IS), a powered exoskeleton system (with weaponry so advanced the world's nations agreed to ban their military application) otherwise usable only by females. He is then enrolled into the Infinite Stratos Academy, where his older sister [[orimura chifuyu|Chifuyu]], herself a former ace IS pilot, teaches. Along the way he meets his [[shinonono houki|childhood friend]], [[cecilia alcott|a British aristocrat]], [[Huang Lingyin|his other, Chinese childhood friend]], [[charlotte dunois|a French transferee]], and [[laura bodewig|a German super-soldier]], each vying for his affection.

h4. Characters

* [[Cecilia Alcott]]
* [[Charlotte Dunois]]

* "Wikipedia: IS (Infinite Stratos)":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IS_(Infinite_Stratos)]

title: hypnosis_microphone
body:
Hypnosis Microphone, also known as a [[Hypnosis Mic]] (which the series is named after), is a series of devices, developed by [[Amayado Rei]], using classified military technology. During World War III, the Party of Words established mass development of Hypnosis Mics.

Once activated, a Hypnosis Mic changes its form after shining bright purple, reflecting the style of its owner and creates speakers behind them. The lyrics channeled through the Mic affect people's sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems, making it possible to attack a person's psyche and alter their state of mind.

Contrary to their name, they do not always come in the form of a typical [[microphone]]. For example, [[Kannonzaka Doppo]]'s comes in the shape of a [[flip phone]], [[Iruma Jyuto]]'s comes in the shape of a police mic, and [[Amaguni Hitoya]]'s comes in the form of a [[balance scale]]. Most of them simply resemble well-decorated microphones. 

[b]This tag should only be used for Hypnosis Microphones that do not resemble usual, undecorated microphones.[/b]
other_names: ヒプノシスマイク(ヒプマイ)

title: hypnosis_mic
body:
A rap battle music franchise by King Records and Evilline Records.

The concept surrounds groups of three rappers, each representing a Tokyo district. They use [[hypnosis microphone]]s in rap battles.

h4. Characters

All rappers have an MC name.

h6. [[Buster Bros!!!]] - Ikebukuro Division
* [[yamada ichiro|Yamada Ichirou]] / MC. B.B. (MC Big Brother)
* [[Yamada Jiro]] / MC. M.B. (MC Middle Brother)
* [[Yamada Saburo]] / MC. L.B. (MC Little Brother)

h6. [[Mad Trigger Crew]] - Yokohama Division
* [[Aohitsugi Samatoki]] / Mr. Hc (Mister Hardcore)
* [[Busujima Rio Mason]] / Crazy M
* [[Iruma Jyuto]] / 45 Rabbit

h6. [[Matenro (hypnosis mic)|]] - Shinjuku Division
* [[Izanami Hifumi]] / GIGOLO
* [[Jinguji Jakurai]] / ill-DOC
* [[Kannonzaka Doppo]] / DOPPO

h6. [[Fling Posse]] - Shibuya Division
* [[Amemura Ramuda]] / easy R
* [[Arisugawa Dice]] / Dead or Alive
* [[Yumeno Gentaro]] / Phantom

h6. [[Dotsuitare Hompo]] - Osaka Division
* [[Amayado Rei]] / MC MasterMind
* [[Nurude Sasara]] / Tragic Comedy
* [[Tsutsujimori Rosho]] / WISDOM

h6. [[Bad Ass Temple]] - Nagoya Division
* [[Aimono Jyushi]] / 14th Moon
* [[Amaguni Hitoya]] / Heaven & Hell
* [[Harai Kuko]] / Evil Monk

h6. [[The Dirty Dawg]]
A group that once consisted of Yamada Ichirou, Aohitsugi Samatoki, Amemura Ramuda, and Jinguuji Jakurai.

h6. Other

title: yamaha_trb
body:
[b]TRB[/b] and [b]TRBX[/b] are a series of [[bass_guitar|bass guitars]] designed and produced by [[Yamaha]]. [b]TRB[/b] originally launched in the early 90s as a versatile 6-string model but later has expanded into a full range of 5-string and 4-string models, while [b]TRBX[/b] lineup features the same body geometry and a slightly shorter 34" scale length and serves as a replacement for now discontinued RBX series.

Prominent players include [[Bocchi the Rock!]]'s [[Hiroi Kikuri]] with her TRB1004J in a natural finish.

h4. See also
[[Fender Jazz Bass]]
[[Fender Precision Bass]]
[[Yamaha Pacifica]]
[[Yamaha Revstar]]
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

Most recognizable of its parts are the three towers of the hotel section that meet in a surfboard-shaped rooftop that holds an infinity pool and observation deck.
