title: yamaha_revstar
body:
Line of solid-body [[electric guitar]]s inspired by café racer [[motorcycle|motorcycles]] by [[Yamaha]]. Originally launched in 2015 as a spiritual successor to Yamaha's own SBG/SG line, the series got a refresh in 2022. Currently produced models feature either 2 Humbucker pickups and a stopbar or 2 P-90 "Soapbars" and a tailpiece, 2 control knobs and 2 racing stripes along the middle of guitar body.

h4. See also
[[Yamaha Pacifica]]
[[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: wishiwashi
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #746 in the National PokéDex, a Water type Pokémon.

If it has reached level 20, it can change its form due to its [i]Schooling[/i] ability:

* [[Wishiwashi (Solo)]] - In this form, Wishiwashi resembles a small fish. It has large, light blue eyes with irises that resemble puddles of water and dark blue eyelids.
* [[Wishiwashi (School)]] - In this form, Wishiwashi resembles a large fish roughly formed from various smaller fish with glowing eyes. Starting with its head, its body is divided into four bands that each becomes a slightly darker shade of blue.

It does not evolve from or into another Pokémon.

Japanese name: [b]Yowashi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Lycanroc]]
Next Pokémon: [[Mareanie]]

title: gibson_sg_(bass)
body:
An umbrella tag for all [[Gibson SG]]-shaped bass guitar series (SG Standard Bass, EB-0, EB-3, etc.). 

Compared to its [[electric guitar]] counterpart, current production model SG Standard Bass has 2 differently sized pickups, 3 control knobs, 4 large tuning machines on the headstock and a longer scale length.

Prominent users include [[Girls Band Cry]]'s [[Rupa_(girls_band_cry)|]] with an Ebony Gibson SG Standard Bass and [[BanG Dream!]]'s [[Ushigome Rimi]] with a pink SG Bass-inspired ESP Viper Bass.

h4. See Also

title: north-west_youth_association
body: The North-West Youth Association, also known as the Northwest Youth League, was a far-right anti-communist [[South Korean]] paramilitary group active during the [[Cold War]]. It is most well known for committing widespread atrocities during the South Korean government-led suppression of the Jeju Uprising.

title: condom_in_mouth
body: A person holding a [[condom]] in their mouth, either still in the [[condom wrapper|wrapper]] or already [[used condom|used]]. Usually a precursor or invitation towards sexual activity. Occasionally the condom is applied via [[fellatio]].

title: paul_blart:_mall_cop
body: A 2009 American comedy film directed by Steve Carr and starring Kevin James as the titular character, Paul Blart. The film follows [[Paul Blart]], a mild-mannered and somewhat clumsy mall security guard who dreams of becoming a police officer. Despite his lack of physical fitness and training, Blart finds himself in a situation where he must single-handedly take on a group of organized criminals who have taken over the mall where he works.

title: cleanrot_knight_finlay
body: [b]Cleanrot Knight Findley[/b] is a spirit ash in [[Elden Ring]], found in [[Miquella (elden ring)|]]'s Haligtree. She is the spirit of a loyal knight of [[Malenia Blade of Miquella]], who carried her master back to the Haligtree after Malenia's battle with [[Starscourge Radahn]] in Caelid. Her attacks are similar to the scythe-wielding [[Cleanrot Knight]]s.

title: goblin_(titanfall)
body:
A type of [[airplane]] from the [[Titanfall (series)|]] universe, used as an infantry dropship by IMC forces during the Frontier War. By the time of the second game's multiplayer they are also used by the Militia.

Goblins appear in [[Apex Legends]] as well, with players jumping out of them when respawned during a match. Inactive Goblins can also be found and entered for loot in parts of [[Kings Canyon]].

title: art_trade
body:
When two artists exchange art with each other based on a request the other gave them. These trades usually have a set meet-up time, and are equal in complexity. This tag is for posts that are drawn as part of said trade. 

Not to be confused with [[gift art]], where an artist draws a piece intended as a gift for someone else and expects nothing in return. 

Only use this tag if you have proof that a post is part of an art trade (like it is mentioned as being in one in the artist's commentary, a link to the other artist's part of the trade, etc).

title: rifle_cartridge
body:
Any [[ammunition]] fired by [[rifle]]s. Larger and longer than a handgun cartridge, smaller than cannon shells. This tag applies to any calibers, ranging from [[assault rifle|intermediate cartridges]] like 5.56mm NATO, full-power rounds like 7.62mm NATO or larger ones fired by [[heavy machine gun]]s such as the .50 BMG.

A decent rule of thumb is that if the cartridge's length is more than 3.5 times the diameter of the case, it lacks a distinct rim, usually has bottlenecked [[shell_casing|case]] and the [[bullet]] diameter is approximately a half inch or less, then it is most likely a rifle cartridge regardless of specific caliber.

h1. External links
* Wikipedia entry: "List of rifle cartridges":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_rifle_cartridges

title: zastava_m70
body:
The [b]Zastava M70[/b] is a [[Yugoslavia]]n 7.62×39mm [[kalashnikov rifle|assault]] [[assault rifle|rifle]], developed by Zastava Arms in the 1960s. It was an unlicensed copy of the Soviet [[AK-47]], while later models are based on the [[AKM]][[AKMS|(S)]]. Its distinct features are longer forearms with three cooling vents and a bulge on the stamped receiver next to the lower forearm.
* !post #5204947: Fixed wooden stock.
* !post #6866146: [[Folding stock]] variant.

h1. See also

title: h&k_p7
body:
The [b][[P7 (Girls' Frontline)|]][/b] is a semi-automatic [[handgun]] of German origin, designed by Helmut Weldle and produced from 1979 to 2008 by [[Heckler & Koch]]. Commonly available in 9×19mm Parabellum, it was designed to replace the [[walther ppk|Walther PP]] in West German [[police]] service. 
The most notable feature of the P7 is its ambidextrous cocking lever at the front of the grip, acting as a safety. 
* !post #7193350

title: ranunculus
body:
[b][i]Ranunculus asiaticus[/i][/b], also known as Persian buttercup, is a cultivated ornamental species of the genus [i][[buttercup (flower)|Ranunculus]][/i] in the family [i]Ranunculaceae[/i]. Common colors include shades of pink, red, orange, yellow, and white.

Visually, the flowers of ranunculus asiaticus are very similar to [[rose]]s and can be difficult to distinguish. They can be identified by their buds, flower shape, and leaves:
* The buds of ranunculus are globular;
* The flowers are densely packed with overlapping petals that, unlike roses, retain a neatly rounded shape with less protruding petals;
** The center of the flowers is very distinctive;
** The flower stems have no thorns;
* The leaves are deeply lobed, resembling many [i]Ranunculaceae[/i] species, making them very different from rose leaves.

h5. Examples
* !asset #21801262: Photo reference: Flower and bud
* !asset #21801263: Photo reference: Opened center of the flower

title: mg42
body:
The [b]MG42[/b] ([i]Maschinengewehr 42[/i]) is a German [[World War II]]-era open-bolt [[machine gun]], chambered for the 7.92×57mm Mauser round. It supplanted the earlier [[MG34]] in 1942 due to lower manufacturing cost thanks to dominant stamped metal parts. Its highest cyclic rate of fire at 1200 RPM, made the [[weapon]] gained the nickname [i]Hitler's Buzzsaw[/i].

The [[MG42 (Girls' Frontline)|]] is recognizable by its [[barrel shroud]] with squared-off profile and larger perforations. It is [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] and also accepts [[dual drum magazine]]s.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG3]] [tn](Post-WWII modernized variant.)[/tn]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: MG42":HTTPS://en.WIKIPEDIA.org/wiki/MG_42

title: wolfsbane_(flower)
body:
[i][b]Aconitum[/b][/i] (also known as aconite or wolfsbane) is a genus of poisonous flowering plants in the [i]Ranunculaceae[/i] family. 

The color of the flowers usually varies from blue to purple, some species are yellowish. They consist of five petals that form a characteristic shape resembling a hood or helmet. This shape gave it its common names, such as [b]devil's helmet[/b], [b]helmet flower[/b], [b]monkshood[/b], [i][b]torikabuto[/i][/b] (鳥兜 lit. "bird's helmet":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鳥兜). The leaves are lobed.

Most Aconitum species are highly poisonous and were historically used to poison the tips of javelins and arrows.

A species of buttercup that grows from tubers, producing red, yellow, white or violet flowers.

Not to be confused with [[poppy (flower)|]]. Anemone flowers have a black button-like center, often surrounded by a white ring. They have small leaves below the flower, while poppy leaves appear much lower on the stem.

title: adonis_(flower)
body:
A genus of about 20-30 species of flowering plants of the crowfoot family, [[ranunculus|Ranunculaceae]], native to Europe and Asia. Their flowers are red, yellow or orange and have 5-30 petals with feathery, finely divided leaves that form a fluffy collar around each individual flower.

Commonly depicted members of the genus are [i][b]Adonis amurensis[/b][/i], a perennial plant with a double-flowered [[yellow flower]] that has around 20-24 petals each, and [i][b]Adonis ramosa[/b][/i]. Their Japanese name "Fukujusō" means "fortune-longevity-plant", so they’re also used for planting at New Year's parties.

title: finger_cots
body:
Also known as [b]finger protectors[/b] or [b]finger gloves[/b]. A covering worn on the fingers; think of reverse fingerless gloves.  
They're typically worn in instances where protecting the fingers are necessary, but when regular [[gloves]] aren't needed, such as certain medical procedures, electronics manufacturing, watchmaking, etc. 

Disposable latex finger cots have been nicknamed "finger condoms" because of their visual similarity to [[condom]]s.

h4. Example
* !post #7055801

h4. See also
* [[thimble]]
* [[fingerless gloves]]
* [[half gloves]]

title: drunken_fist
body: A martial art involving stances, movements, and attacks that imitate the behavior of a [[drunk]] person. Also known as "Zui Quan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drunken_boxing]. Fictional portrayals may feature actually drunk practitioners, though in real life intoxication would interfere with one's balance, vision, and other capacities needed for combat and self-defense.

title: takt_op.

title: learning_with_pibby
body: A conceptual animated series and a pitch for a potential TV show created by Dodge Greenley. The premise revolves around a preschool-like character named [[Pibby]], who finds herself in a dark, apocalyptic scenario where a corruption threatens to consume all of the cartoon worlds. She teams up with other characters from different animated universes to fight against this spreading darkness.

title: kyoresu
body:
[[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber]] who also creates original music & music covers. Her fans are called [[Kyopi (kyoresu)|]], which is kyOresu's [[mascot]] that has the appearance of a [[pill]] with a cat face on top.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7514013: Default costume

She has a small body type with a [[flat chest]]. She has [[purple eyes|purple]]/[[blue eyes|blue]] eyes with a [[bandaid on forehead|bandaid on her forhead]]. For her default haristyle, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[pink hair|pink]] to [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[parted bangs]] in [[twintails]] held with a [[white scrunchie]].
For her default costume, she wears a [[pink track suit]] with a [[pink jacket|pink]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[long sleeves]] worn over [[black shirt|black]] [[high collar]]ed [[shirt]] underneath, a [[pink bag|pink]] [[backpack]], [[pink pants|pink]] [[vertical-striped pants]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[high tops]].

h4. External links

* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/@kyOresu]

title: madotsuki
body:
(lit. 'window', as in a box or envelope or "aperture")

The protagonist and player character of Kikiyama's cult game [i][[Yume Nikki]][/i]. Has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]] and tied in [[twin braids]], and her eyes are almost always [[closed_eyes|closed]] within the game. Is often associated with a [[kitchen knife]]; one of her most known "effects".

She usually wears a [[pink sweater|pink]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[red skirt]], [[white socks]] and [[red_footwear|red]] [[shoes]].

title: senshi_(dungeon_meshi)
body:
[i][[Dungeon Meshi]][/i] character.

Senshi is a [[dwarf]] the party met already living in the dungeon they hope to conquer. He's well-versed in preparing food from monsters and other ingredients found in the dungeon, and is adamant that the party always eat nutritiously. He carries a mithril cooking [[knife]] and adamantine [[cooking pot]] (which any other dwarf would likely consider a sacrilegious misuse of said materials).

He has thick [[black hair]], a [[mustache]], and a [[beard]] nearly as long as he is tall. Like most dwarves in the series, he wears little armor, because while dwarves are [[muscular_male|stronger]] than their larger "tallmen" counterparts, they tire quickly (likely from a combination of short legs and more muscular torsos leaving less room for their hearts and lungs) and aren't suited to carrying large loads for a long time, so outside of his signature [[horned helmet]] he only has a couple other assorted pieces of metal armor, instead opting for a [[leather]] [[kilt]] and [[bracer]]s. His eyes are often drawn as [[solid circle pupils]].

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/573ff44a-0a01-453e-954f-cfcae230a200]

title: dilated_pupils
body:
Use when the pupil is noticeably larger than usual relative to the iris.  Can variously be elements of the eyes of a character expressing a deep affection (particular to, but not limited to [[yandere]] types), suffering from a lack of focus (also consistent with [[drugs|drug use]]) or simply undergoing an autonomous reflex from being in a low-light environment.

h4. Related tags
* [[Constricted pupils]] – the opposite.
* [[Sanpaku]] – when the iris is constricted.
* [[Wide-eyed]] – the eyes themselves are widened.
* [[Crazy eyes]] – any eyes used to indicate mental derangement.

* [[Tag Group:Eyes Tags]]

title: taurus_(constellation)
body:
Taurus (the [[Bull]]) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere, between [[Aries (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Gemini (constellation)|]] to the east. Its brightest star is Aldebaran, which is part of the "[i]Winter Hexagon[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winter_Hexagon. The constellation is also home to two star clusters, the Pleiades and the Hyades.

Taurus resembles a two-pronged fork with a bright V-shaped center (see post #8405 for reference). The prongs symbolize the horns of the bull. One of the horns is connected to another constellation, [[Auriga (constellation)|]] (the Charioteer).

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #20766760

* !asset #20766763

title: inubashiri_momiji
body:
The "White Wolf Tengu". Stage 4 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [i]Mountain of Faith[/i].

A [[wolf girl|wolf]] tengu with the ability to see great distances who patrols Youkai Mountain. For lack of official art, she is commonly depicted with [[wolf ears]] and [[wolf tail|tail]], even if inconsistently shown in official side manga. She is known for her cooperative and dutiful personality, so early fanworks often portrayed her as loyal and puppy-like to [[Shameimaru Aya]], but it was later revealed that she dislikes Aya and will not take orders from her since they belong to different chains of command.

Genderswapped/trap (otoko no ko) Momiji is very popular, and is tagged as ショタ椛 on Pixiv.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair|white]] or [[grey hair]] with [[medium bangs|medium-length bangs]] and usually has [[animal ear fluff|fluff in her ears]] and [[red eyes|red]] or [[brown eyes]]. She wears a small [[red hat|red]] [[tokin hat]] with dangling [[pom pom (clothes)|]]s, a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[turtleneck shirt|turtleneck]] [[white shirt]], [[ribbon-trimmed sleeves|ribbon-trimmed]] [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], a [[two-tone skirt|two-tone]] [[black skirt|black]] and [[red skirt]] with a [[maple leaf print|maple leaf]] [[print skirt|print]], and [[tengu-geta]]. She usually carries a [[holding sword|sword]] and a [[holding shield|shield]].

h4. See also 

* [[Inubashiri Momiji (Wolf)]] 
* [[Mofuji]] 

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Momiji Inubashiri":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Momiji_Inubashiri

title: juusenki_l-gaim
body:
[b][i]Heavy Metal L-Gaim[/i][/b] (重戦機（ヘビーメタル）エルガイム, [i]Jūsenki (Hebī Metaru) Erugaimu[/i], literally "Heavy Military Strategy L-Gaim") is an 80s [[science fiction]] space opera [[mecha]] anime television series which aired in [[Japan]] from 1984 to 1985. It was produced by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]] and was directed by [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]]. L-Gaim is heavily influenced by previous sci-fi movies of the time, mostly [[Star Wars]].

Its characters and mecha were designed by [[Nagano Mamoru]], who would later go on to make designs for [[Zeta Gundam]] and create The [[Five Star Stories]] series.

title: serbu_super-shorty
body:
The [b]Super-Shorty[/b] is a compact shotgun manufactured in the US by Serbu Firearms. It is essentially a conventional pump-action shotgun with no shoulder stock and an extremely short (usually 6½ inches) barrel, hence the name. Since the tubular magazine of such a shotgun can be no longer than the barrel, this modification also sharply limits the weapon's magazine capacity to only two rounds (as opposed to the five to seven typical of full-length pump-action shotguns).

As a smoothbore handgun, the Super-Shorty is classified as "Any Other Weapon" under the US National Firearms Act of 1934, meaning civilian transfers of ownership in the United States require the purchase of a $5 federal tax stamp and registration with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives.

wikipedia: "Serbu Super-Shorty":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serbu_Super-Shorty]

title: indirect_kiss
body:
A trope where a character who likes someone else shares food or a drink with them and calls it an "indirect kiss."

In older and grittier works, an indirect kiss can be seen in the form of sharing a [[cigarette]]; in some cases this would be if one person lit a cigarette with the other's cigarette.

title: ammunition_belt
body:
A belt of [[ammunition]] as feeding device for belt-fed [[gun|firearms]]. Commonly [[machine gun]], [[minigun]] or [[Gatling gun]].

The [[rifle cartridge|cartridges]] are held in chains of looped metal links which can be connected to form belts of any length. It may disintegrate after firing or not. These disposable links are discarded (along with the empty [[shell casing]]s) upon firing. 

Not to be confused with a [[bandolier]], which is a belt or sash containing cartridges worn on a person's chest, or an [[ammunition pouch]], which is a [[pouch]] for holding ammunition that may be worn around the waist.

She has a [[short_hair|short]] [[purple_hair|purple]] [[bob cut]] with [[bangs]] and [[hairclip]]s, [[green_eyes|greenish]] [[blue eyes]], and [[dark-skinned_female|dark]] [[dark_skin|skin]].

Her typical outfit consists of a [[cropped_vest|cropped]] [[red_vest|red]] [[vest]] over a [[white_bandeau|white]] [[bandeau]] [[tube top]] exposing her [[midriff]], and a long red [[pelvic curtain]] / [[loincloth]] that occasionally exposes her [[white panties]]. She also wears [[brown_footwear|brown]] [[cross-laced_sandals|cross-laced]] [[sandals]], a [[pendant]] [[necklace]] with a blue diamond-shaped [[gem]], and a number of pieces of gold jewelry including [[hoop_earrings|hoop]] [[earrings]], [[neck ring]]s, [[armlet]]s, and [[bracelet]]s.

title: k.a.r.r.
body:
[b]K.A.R.R.[/b] is the short name of a fictional sentient robot character from the American adventure and science fiction TV series [[Knight Rider]] released in the 80s.

An acronym for [b]Knight Automated Roving Robot[/b]. Like [[K.I.T.T]], KARR is an artificially intelligent electronic computer module in the body of a highly advanced, very mobile, robotic automobile: a 1982 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am sports "car":[/wiki_pages/car].
Unlike KITT, whose primary directive is to protect human life, KARR was programmed for self-preservation, making him a ruthless and unpredictable threat. KARR was featured in two episodes of the original 1982 series.

KARR was voiced by "Peter Cullen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Cullen] in Season 1 episode [i]Trust Doesn't Rust[/i], and in Season 3 episode [i]K.I.T.T vs K.A.R.R[/i], he was voiced by "Paul Frees":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Frees]. In the Knight Rider 2008 series, he was once again voiced by Peter Cullen.

title: russo-japanese_war
body:
The Russo–Japanese War (1904–05) was fought between the Russian Empire and the Empire of Japan over territorial ambitions in Manchuria and Korea. Russia suffered a series of defeats, and lost a large portion of their navy at the Battle of Tsushima. The war ended in a peace treaty brokered by [[Theodore Roosevelt]], which many in Japan felt did not contain favorable enough terms considering their military superiority. The war marked the emergence of Japan as a major world power, and one of the catalyst of the Russian revolution and subsequent civil war in 1917.

h4. See Also

* [[tag_group:history]]

title: chinese_civil_war
body:
A civil war within [[China]] from 1921 to 1949. The war began after the collapse of the first Republic of China which saw the country being divided between various rival warlords who fought to unite the country. In 1927, the [[Kuomintang]] (KMT)-led Republic of China under the leadership of [[Chiang Kai-shek]] managed to unite a large part of the country, however, conflict between the then allied Chinese Communist Party (CCP) resulted in a crackdown that forced the CCP on "The Long March" to the northern parts of the country between 1934 - 1935. The outbreak of the [[Second Sino-Japanese war]] in 1937 forced the KMT and CCP to work together to defend the country.

After [[Japan]] was defeated in [[World War II]] in 1945, fighting between both parties resumed. While the KMT had a manpower and weaponry advantage, it was plagued with corruption and economical problems. Meanwhile, the smaller CCP forces led by [[Mao Zedong]] used a combination of disciplined guerilla fighters, hit-and-run tactics, and various propaganda methods to recruit more members. After several key warlords and troops defected to the CCP, the KMT lost the control of the mainland China in 1949 and retreated to the island of [[Taiwan]] while the CCP established the People's Republic of China (PRC) over it.

As there is no official armistice, the civil war is still considered ongoing, with tensions between mainland China and Taiwan and its complex political status remains an issue.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_Civil_War]

title: american_revolution
body:
A military conflict between the [[United Kingdom|British Empire]] and the 13 American colonies that took place from 1776 to 1783 and ended with the Treaty of Paris, in which the British Empire formally acknowledged the independence and sovereignty of the colonies. Following the war the colonies formed their own country, the [[united states|United States of America]].

h4. See Also

* [[tag_group:history]]
other_names: アメリカ合衆国の独立

title: historical_name_connection
body:
A subset of [[name connection]] where the characters being paired are based on the same historical entity (whether it's a real person, vehicle, characters, or other famous object).

For posts referencing specific historical connections between characters, use [[historical connection]] instead.

title: boston_celtics
body:
A professional [[basketball]] team based in [[Boston]], Massachusetts. They are a member of the Eastern Conference of the [[National Basketball Association]] (NBA) and were founded in 1946. The Celtics have won 18 NBA championships, the most in the NBA, and are one of the most successful and historic franchises in the league.

The Boston Celtics' traditional uniform colors are green and white. The team's primary home uniform is white with green lettering, while the primary road uniform is green with white lettering. The team also has alternate uniforms with different color combinations, such as a black uniform with green and white trim.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Boston Celtics":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Celtics]
